title: What is the Doha tennis schedule?
description: Semi-final day has arrived at the Qatar ExxonMobil Open in Doha, with two intriguing matches on Friday. The 2020 champion Andrey Rublev is the highest seed left in the draw and will look to reach his first tour-level final of the season against Felix Auger-Aliassime. The Canadian is chasing his third ATP Tour title of the year and benefited from a Daniil Medvedev quarter-final retirement. Fourth seed Rublev leads Auger-Aliassiame 5-1 in the pair's Lexus ATP Head2Head series, having defeated the 24-year-old in the Madrid final last season. In the second singles semi-final of the day, Jiri Lehecka will aim to back up his victory against Carlos Alcaraz when he takes on Jack Draper. Lehecka is competing in the semi-finals in Doha for the second time (2023), while Draper is making his debut. There is also doubles action at the ATP 500. View the full Friday schedule below. ORDER OF PLAY - FRIDAY, 21 FEBRUARY 2025 Center Court - start 2:00 PM Joe Salisbury (GBR) / Neal Skupski (GBR) vs [2] Harri Heliovaara (FIN) / Henry Patten (GBR) Yuki Bhambri (IND) / Ivan Dodig (CRO) vs Julian Cash (GBR) / Lloyd Glasspool (GBR) Not Before 6:00 PM Felix Auger-Aliassime (CAN) vs [5] Andrey Rublev Jiri Lehecka (CZE) vs [8] Jack Draper (GBR) [NEWSLETTER FORM]
excerpt: Andrey Rublev, Felix Auger-Aliassime, Jiri Lehecka and Jack Draper are in semi-final action in Doha on Friday.

The 2020 champion Andrey Rublev is the highest seed left in the draw and will look to reach his first tour-level final of the season against Felix Auger-Aliassime. The Canadian is chasing his third ATP Tour title of the year and benefited from a Daniil Medvedev quarter-final retirement. Fourth seed Rublev leads Auger-Aliassiame 5-1 in the pair's Lexus ATP Head2Head series, having defeated the 24-year-old in the Madrid final last season. In the second singles semi-final of the day, Jiri Lehecka will aim to back up his victory against Carlos Alcaraz when he takes on Jack Draper. Lehecka is competing in the semi-finals in Doha for the second time (2023), while Draper is making his debut. There is also doubles action at the ATP 500. View the full Friday schedule below. ORDER OF PLAY - FRIDAY, 21 FEBRUARY 2025 Center Court - start 2:00 PM Joe Salisbury (GBR) / Neal Skupski (GBR) vs [2] Harri Heliovaara (FIN) / Henry Patten (GBR) Yuki Bhambri (IND) / Ivan Dodig (CRO) vs Julian Cash (GBR) / Lloyd Glasspool (GBR) Not Before 6:00 PM Felix Auger-Aliassime (CAN) vs [5] Andrey Rublev Jiri Lehecka (CZE) vs [8] Jack Draper (GBR)
html:
Doha

Rublev, Felix headline semi-final action

February 20, 2025

QTF/Paul Zimmer

By ATP Staff

Semi-final day has arrived at the Qatar ExxonMobil Open in Doha, with two intriguing matches on Friday.

The 2020 champion Andrey Rublev is the highest seed left in the draw and will look to reach his first tour-level final of the season against Felix Auger-Aliassime. The Canadian is chasing his third ATP Tour title of the year and benefited from a Daniil Medvedev quarter-final retirement. Fourth seed Rublev leads Auger-Aliassiame 5-1 in the pair's Lexus ATP Head2Head series, having defeated the 24-year-old in the Madrid final last season.

In the second singles semi-final of the day, Jiri Lehecka will aim to back up his victory against Carlos Alcaraz when he takes on Jack Draper. Lehecka is competing in the semi-finals in Doha for the second time (2023), while Draper is making his debut. There is also doubles action at the ATP 500.

View the full Friday schedule below.

ORDER OF PLAY - FRIDAY, 21 FEBRUARY 2025

Center Court - start 2:00 PM
Joe Salisbury (GBR) / Neal Skupski (GBR) vs [2] Harri Heliovaara (FIN) / Henry Patten (GBR)
Yuki Bhambri (IND) / Ivan Dodig (CRO) vs Julian Cash (GBR) / Lloyd Glasspool (GBR)

Not Before 6:00 PM

Felix Auger-Aliassime (CAN) vs [5] Andrey Rublev
Jiri Lehecka (CZE) vs [8] Jack Draper (GBR)
